cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 250 mi WSW of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: moving ENE toward the Cayman Islands today, expected to cross central Cuba tonight/Sunday then turn north-northwest toward the Florida Keys and South Florida late Sunday into Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys or extreme South Florida

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sebastian Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including Lake Okeechobee, the Florida Keys and Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northwestern Bahamas and several central Cuban provinces
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cayman Islands, central Cuba, Florida Keys, South and Southwest Florida coastline including Port Everglades area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible late Sunday night through Monday with peak 34-kt probability 24% and cumulative 44% (gusts 40–50 mph possible).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible along the southeast Florida coast including Port Everglades when onshore flow coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches possible across South Florida, producing flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A tornado or two Sunday night into Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents.
